intro: Strychnos staudtii, commonly known as the African strychnos, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically orange to red in color. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
